message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Antifreeze can cause ethylene glycol poisoning and Fomepizole is the drug of choice for treatment.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Antifreeze contains ethylene glycol, which can cause metabolic acidosis and neurological symptoms. Fomepizole is a specific antidote for ethylene glycol toxicity and is the appropriate treatment in this scenario. Dimercaprol is used for heavy metal poisoning, N-acetylcysteine is used for acetaminophen toxicity, and Flumazenil is used to reverse benzodiazepine overdose.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Freshly spilled antifreeze can cause ethylene glycol poisoning, and Fomepizole is the antidote for this type of poisoning. Dimercaprol is used for heavy metal poisoning, N-acetylcysteine is used for acetaminophen overdose, and Flumazenil is used for benzodiazepine overdose.
